Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery bowl; micaceous clay with white inclusions; interior glazed with added red and white decoration: frieze of red rays lined in white between bands of white-red-white; exterior: cream slip; on lip, tongues, every fourth red; animal frieze below: two antithetical lions, heads turned back (one of them party preserved), part of a goose to right; below, meander zone; added red on manes, haunches and on lower bellies of lions and on neck and alternate section of wing of goose; details of lions and of goose incised; filling ornament: rosettes; inscription cut on exterior, over main frieze.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), area of (near the scarab factory (Petrie letter to Poole, 11th May 1885).)
Curator's comments: The piece is mentioned in Petrie's journal for 1884-5, p.204, and the context could be taken to be nearer the Apollo sanctuary; but it is more likely that he is here changing topic, to the discerning of the name of Aphrodite on this sherd.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243, no. 2, fig. 2: a)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pp. 16, 18, 48, 50, pl. VI, no. 5, pl. XXXV, no. 700)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 676, no. 352)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.238)
